title: Combating Alzheimer's Through Sleep and Exercise (CASE)
description_brief: The purpose of this research is to see how sleep and exercise affects dementia risk over time.
explanation_target: Reason: The study ("Combating Alzheimer's Through Sleep and Exercise"; NCT04855630) tests lifestyle interventions — sleep monitoring using a DREEM 2 headband and an exercise routine — to see how sleep and exercise affect dementia risk over time, not a drug or biologic. citeturn1search1turn1search6

Act (extracted trial details): The trial interventions are listed as a device (DREEM 2 Headband) and an Exercise Routine; lead sponsor is University of Miami; registry identifier NCT04855630. Start date listed March 1, 2023 and estimated completion March 1, 2026. citeturn1search1turn1search0turn1search3

Reflect: Category definitions — (1) disease-targeted biologic, (2) disease-targeted small molecule, (3) cognitive enhancer, (4) neuropsychiatric symptom improvement — all refer to pharmacologic/biologic or symptom-targeting drug interventions. This trial is a behavioral/device lifestyle intervention (sleep/exercise monitoring and guided exercise) and therefore does not fit any of the four specified categories; classify as 'N/A'. citeturn1search6turn1search2
